name: Bar Harbor Bankshares
description: Bar Harbor Bankshares is a financial services holding company based in Bar Harbor, Maine. Founded in 1887, it operates through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Bar Harbor Bank & Trust, which provides a full range of banking services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management, and insurance services. The bank has a strong community focus and is dedicated to enhancing the financial wellbeing of its clients through personalized service and innovative financial solutions. With a network of branches across Maine and New Hampshire, Bar Harbor Bankshares is committed to building long-lasting relationships with its customers and contributing to the local economy. The company emphasizes sustainable banking practices and is dedicated to supporting the communities it serves through various initiatives, including financial literacy programs and charitable contributions. Bar Harbor Bankshares also offers digital banking services, providing clients with convenient and secure access to their accounts. The company’s mission is to be a trusted partner in its customers' financial journeys, helping them achieve their goals through sound financial advice and comprehensive banking solutions.

seo.meta_title: Bar Harbor Bankshares | Community Banking in Maine and New Hampshire
seo.meta_description: Bar Harbor Bankshares offers a wide range of banking and financial services, focusing on community engagement and personalized customer service.

faq.question: What services does Bar Harbor Bankshares offer?
faq.answer: Bar Harbor Bankshares offers personal banking, commercial banking, wealth management, and insurance services.

faq.question: Where is Bar Harbor Bankshares headquartered?
faq.answer: Bar Harbor Bankshares is headquartered in Bar Harbor, Maine, USA.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Bar Harbor Bankshares?
faq.answer: Curtis C. Simard is the CEO of Bar Harbor Bankshares.

faq.question: When was Bar Harbor Bankshares founded?
faq.answer: Bar Harbor Bankshares was founded in 1887.
